title: well..
content: HTML Comments are not allowed

title: Re: well..
content:
I believe "HTML Comments are not allowed" should be used as an expression of shock/surprise, eg: "You just built a 3D Keen game in half an hour... HTML Comments are not allowed" Why? I have no idea.

I really should get one of the Jazz Jackrabbit games. I have a decade of retro gaming to catch up on.

EDIT:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Use MoSlo or DOSBox.[hr][/quote]
If you read RJ's post, she does say that she's using DOSBox. I wouldn't want to run MoSlo on my PC, because slowing my PC down too far could cause it to die a horrible death. Stupid XP.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]
Probably the "runtime error 200" error which means your computer is too fast. Use MoSlo or DOSBox.

title: Gah.
content:
If I may hijack this thread for a moment:

[quote]Quote:[hr]LL" ...ST needs exclusive acess to some files...[hr][/quote]

Are these files installed with the game? I can't seem to get any copy of Jazz 1 working recently (JazzCD, and two versions of Jazz 1 Shareware) no matter how many times I uninstall then reinstall them. It tells me that there are essential files missing. I've come to the conclusion that these files probably aren't included with the game.

Interestingly, Duke2 (Episode One) and Cosmo don't work either, regardless of re-installations. Perhaps there's some system file needed to run these games which has been corrupted or something...

title: Re: Gah.
content:
Not game files, windoze files. Dosbox does some nasty things to windoze security.

Odd that you should be missing files, Try downloading the shareware jazz. If that don't run, something is major worng.A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: re: Screenthief
content: Wouldn't it be more practical to take screenshots using the screenshot function? Backspace+F12.

title: Re: re: Screenthief
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]UR: Wouldn't it be more practical to take screenshots using the screenshot function?[hr][/quote]
You are talking about when running under DOSBox, I assume. Unfortunatly Jazz won't work with it (for me, at least) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

... and incase you're thinking it, I don't try to run Screen Theif in DOSBox... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]


EDIT: I apologise, I was reading the Jazz2Online forums just then, and it appears that the Backspace+F2 actually applies to Jazz itself (I'd thought you were talking about DOSBox). I'd never known about that.

The files (which I assume are the screen shots) are in LBM format - how would one go about viewing such a file?

title: Re: re: Screenthief
content:
One would get the new Wombat 0.5 beta from [url=http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/index.php?section=wombat]here[/url], as it allows one to open Jazz .lbm screenshots and export them as bitmaps. Simply open the .lbm as a Jazz Jackrabbit file and it should be OK. Jazz tiles also come up. No guarantees, though, being a beta and all.

As for the official progam used to open .lmb's - not sure.----------------------
Support (at least partially) for 27 games!
Check out the progress of Wombat Game Tools [url=http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/index.php?section=wombatwip]here[/url]
